valueExpression.name: overall-financial-hardship
valueExpression.expression: (%worry-score = 3 or %worry-score = 4 or %worry-score = 5) or (%afford-basics-score = 2 or %afford-basics-score = 3) or (%run-out-score = 3 or %run-out-score = 4)

valueExpression.name: no-financial-hardship
valueExpression.expression: (%overall-financial-hardship = false) and (%moderate-food-insecurity = false) and (%high-food-insecurity = false) and (%moderate-housing-insecurity = false) and (%high-housing-insecurity = false) and (%moderate-paying-bills = false) and (%high-paying-bills = false) and (%moderate-medical-hardships = false) and (%moderate-debt = false) and (%high-debt = false)

item.text: These days, many people experience financial difficulties. To better understand how we can best assist you, I'd like to ask you a few questions about your financial situation.

Tip #1
The Financial Wellness Tool is a brief survey that will help you identify the areas of financial hardship that are of greatest need for your client.

Tip #2
The first set of questions measure the level of financial stress (subjective perception of your clients). The next sets of questions will help you objectively categorize the most pressing areas of need, such as food insecurity.
taskId of financial wellness tool pdf
When you think about your financial situation, how much do you worry?
How hard is it for you to pay for the very basics, like food, housing, medical care, and heating? Would you say it is...?
In the past 12 months, how often did you run out of money between paychecks or before the end of the month? Would you say that happened…?

The following are two statements that some people have made about their food situation. Please indicate whether each statement was often true, sometimes true, or never true for you in the last 12 months.
"I worried whether my food would run out before I got money to buy more."
"The food that I bought just didn't last and I didn't have money to get more."
In the past 12 months, did you not pay the full amount of rent or mortgage because there wasn't enough money?
In the past 12 months, did you move in with other people even for a little while because of financial problems?
In the past 12 months, did you stay at a shelter, in an abandoned building, an automobile, or any other place not meant for regular housing, even for one night?
In the past 12 months, did you not pay the full amount of your phone, gas, heating, water, or electricity bill because there wasn’t enough money?
In the past 12 months, was your phone, gas, heating, water, or electricity service ever cut off because there wasn't enough money to pay the bills?
In the past 12 months, was there a time when you or anyone else in your household needed to see a doctor, a dentist, or go to the hospital but couldn't go because of the cost?
How strongly do you agree or disagree with the following statement? "I have too much debt right now"

Tip
Mention areas of moderate or high hardship using language that will be easy for the client to understand. For example, instead of saying "food insecurity", you could say "difficulties with food" and instead of saying "housing hardship", you could say "issues with your housing."

Example dialogue #1
"Would you mind taking a few minutes to talk with me about your answers to the screening questions that you answered earlier about your financial situation?"

Example dialogue #2
"It sounds like you’re facing some financial difficulties. This is very common, and it can be very distressing."
• Probable Moderate Hardship Paying Bills (basic services)
• Probable High Hardship Paying Bills (basic services)
• The client shows no signs of any financial hardship
